thread.title_full: 10 Iconic Restaurants In North Dakota That Secretly Serve The State's Best Steaks

author: Ruby Foster
title: 10 Iconic Restaurants In North Dakota That Secretly Serve The State's Best Steaks
text:
Looking for amazing steaks in North Dakota that locals keep to themselves?
These 10 restaurants offer mouthwatering cuts and unforgettable flavors!
1. The Ranch Steakhouse (Devils Lake) The Ranch Steakhouse: When a building looks this much like a postcard from the heartland, you know the steaks inside will make memories just as lasting. Photo credit: NDdevilslake The Ranch Steakhouse looks like what would happen if a barn decided to become a restaurant – and I mean that as the highest compliment!
That big red building with the stone foundation is impossible to miss, and it sets the perfect tone for what’s inside.
The moment you walk through those doors, you’re hit with the amazing smell of grilling steaks and the warm buzz of happy diners.
The place has that cozy, rustic charm that makes you want to settle in for the evening.
Their steaks are the stuff of local legend.
The Ranch Steakhouse: This barn-red beauty isn’t just a restaurant—it’s a North Dakota landmark where beef is treated with the reverence it deserves. Photo credit: Mantis Toboggan Thick, juicy cuts that take up half the plate and are seasoned with a perfect blend of spices that enhances rather than masks the natural flavor of the beef.
What’s great about The Ranch is how they nail the sides too.
The baked potatoes are massive, the vegetables are fresh, and everything on your plate feels like it got special attention – not just the steak.
The Ranch has that magical quality where it feels special enough for a celebration but comfortable enough for a random Tuesday night dinner.
It’s the kind of place that becomes “your place” after just one visit.
Where: 1119 Hwy 20 S, Devils Lake, ND 58301
2. Harry’s Steakhouse (Grand Forks) Harry’s Steakhouse: That classic brick facade and bold red door practically whisper, “Come in, the steaks are sizzling and the conversation’s flowing!” Photo credit: Eddy Frisk Harry’s Steakhouse stands out with its classic brick exterior and that eye-catching red door that practically shouts “steak lovers welcome!”
The place has that perfect balance – upscale enough for special occasions but welcoming enough for weeknight dinners.
When you walk in, the rich aroma of sizzling beef tells you immediately that you’ve made a smart choice.
The warm lighting and comfortable seating create an atmosphere where you want to linger.
Their steaks are prepared with obvious expertise – perfectly seared on the outside, exactly the right doneness on the inside.
Harry’s Steakhouse: Like a time capsule of steakhouse perfection, Harry’s stands ready to welcome you with its unmistakable mid-century charm and modern flavors. Photo credit: bradford fish Each cut showcases the quality of the beef rather than hiding it under heavy sauces or complicated preparations.
The menu offers all the classic steakhouse options – from tender filet mignon to robust ribeyes – and each comes with sides that complement rather than compete with the main attraction.
What makes Harry’s special is their consistency.
The steaks are excellent every single time, the service is attentive without being intrusive, and the overall experience leaves you planning your next visit before you’ve finished your meal.
Where: 421 DeMers Ave, Grand Forks, ND 58201
3. Jack’s Steakhouse & Seafood (Bismarck) Jack’s Steakhouse: That bright orange roof is like a beacon for beef lovers—a promise of sizzling satisfaction that Jack’s delivers on every single time. Photo credit: Jack’s Steakhouse & Seafood Jack’s Steakhouse & Seafood catches your eye right away with that bright orange roof and welcoming patio area.
It’s like the building itself is saying, “Hey, good times happen here!”
Inside, the place strikes that perfect balance between casual and upscale.
You can come as you are, but the food and service make you feel like you’re somewhere special.
Their steaks are cooked with obvious skill and care.
Each cut is prepared to bring out its unique qualities – the ribeye has that perfect marbling, the sirloin that ideal balance of flavor and tenderness.
What sets Jack’s apart is their attention to detail with the cooking process.
Jack’s Steakhouse: Clean lines, modern design, and that signature orange roof—Jack’s stands out in Bismarck like a perfectly seared steak on a plain white plate. Photo credit: Jack’s Steakhouse & Seafood The steaks have that beautiful crust on the outside while staying perfectly done to your liking on the inside – a trick that’s harder to pull off than it looks.
The seafood options make this place extra special for North Dakota.
You can get surf and turf that would make coastal restaurants jealous, right here in the middle of the prairie.
The atmosphere at Jack’s manages to be both energetic and relaxed at the same time.
It’s the kind of place where you can hear yourself talk, but there’s still a happy buzz in the air.
Where: 1201 S 12th St, Bismarck, ND 58504
4. Fogão Gaúcho Brazilian Steakhouse (Bismarck) Fogão Gaúcho: That metal bull sculpture isn’t just art—it’s a warning that serious meat business happens inside this Brazilian steakhouse paradise. Photo credit: QuaTeisha Nelson Fogão Gaúcho brings something totally different to North Dakota’s steak scene – a Brazilian steakhouse experience that turns dinner into an adventure!
The building has that modern, slightly upscale look with the brick exterior and stylish entrance.
What makes this place special is the unique way they serve meat.
Instead of ordering one steak, servers come around with skewers of different cuts, slicing meat right onto your plate until you say stop.
The variety is mind-boggling – from classic cuts like top sirloin and ribeye to more unusual offerings like picanha (a Brazilian specialty) and lamb chops.
Each one is seasoned differently and cooked to perfection.
Fogão Gaúcho: Brick, glass, and endless meat skewers await inside this temple to Brazilian barbecue that somehow found its perfect home in Bismarck. Photo credit: Ben Buchmiller That metal bull sculpture outside isn’t just for show – it represents the gaucho tradition of excellent meat preparation that this restaurant celebrates.
It’s like a little piece of Brazil right in Bismarck!
The salad bar here isn’t an afterthought – it’s a spectacular spread of fresh vegetables, cheeses, cold cuts, and Brazilian specialties that could be a meal in itself.
But save room for all that meat!
What’s great about Fogão Gaúcho is how it turns dinner into a social experience.
The constant parade of servers with different meats keeps the energy up and gives you something to talk about beyond the usual dinner conversation.
Where: 4510 Skyline Crossings, Bismarck, ND 58503
5. 109 Club and Steakhouse (Lignite) 109 Club: Don’t let the humble exterior fool you—some of life’s greatest pleasures hide behind the simplest facades, especially in small-town North Dakota. Photo credit: Dave Mariani Don’t let the humble exterior of 109 Club fool you – this unassuming building in tiny Lignite is hiding some of the best steaks in North Dakota!
It’s the definition of a hidden gem.
This place proves that great food doesn’t need fancy surroundings.
The simple metal building might make you wonder what you’re getting into, but locals know that’s part of its charm.
The steaks here are the real deal – hand-cut, perfectly seasoned, and cooked by people who understand meat.
109 Club: This unassuming building in tiny Lignite proves that great steaks don’t need fancy surroundings—just skilled hands and quality beef. Photo credit: Dave Mariani Each one comes out sizzling hot with that perfect combination of char on the outside and juicy tenderness inside.
What makes 109 Club special is the surprising quality you find in such a small town.
You’d expect to find steaks this good in a big city, not in a town where everyone knows everyone.
The portions are generous – the kind that make you say “wow” when they arrive at your table.
No tiny gourmet presentations here, just honest, hearty food that satisfies.
The atmosphere is pure small-town North Dakota – friendly, unpretentious, and welcoming.
You might come in as a stranger, but you’ll leave feeling like you’ve been coming there for years.
Where: 118 Main St, Lignite, ND 58752
6. Brickhouse Grille (Dickinson) Brickhouse Grille: Historic brick, classic architecture, and steaks that would make the original Walton Block residents proud—some traditions age beautifully. Photo credit: Eli Thomas The Brickhouse Grille has that classic small-town charm with its historic brick building right on the corner of downtown Dickinson.
The “Walton Block” sign above tells you this place has stories to tell.

Inside, they’ve kept the character of the old building while creating a warm, inviting space.
The exposed brick walls and wooden accents give it that perfect blend of historic and contemporary.
Their steaks are cooked with obvious care and expertise.
Brickhouse Grille: Corner buildings like this have witnessed generations of Dickinson life—now they’re witnessing some of the town’s finest steaks too. Photo credit: Brickhouse Grille Each cut is prepared to highlight its natural flavors, with seasonings that complement rather than overwhelm the quality of the meat.
What makes Brickhouse special is how they balance tradition and innovation.
The classic steakhouse offerings are all there, but they’re not afraid to add creative touches that keep things interesting.
The restaurant has that perfect neighborhood vibe – it feels special enough for a celebration but comfortable enough that locals drop in regularly.
It’s the kind of place that becomes part of the community fabric.
The service strikes that perfect balance too – professional without being stuffy, friendly without being intrusive.
You feel taken care of from the moment you walk in until the last bite of dessert.
Where: 2 W Villard St, Dickinson, ND 58601
7. LongHorn Steakhouse (Bismarck) LongHorn Steakhouse: Even with snow on the ground, that warm terracotta exterior promises a cozy refuge where great steaks await. Photo credit: Beka Gonashvili LongHorn Steakhouse brings its distinctive Western-inspired look to Bismarck with that warm terracotta building and stone accents.
It stands out even in winter when the snow piles up around it!
Inside, the restaurant has that perfect balance of casual and special occasion.
The Western theme is present without being over-the-top, creating a comfortable atmosphere that works for date night or family dinner.
Their steaks are consistently excellent – always cooked exactly as ordered and seasoned with their signature blend that enhances the natural flavor of the beef.
The Outlaw Ribeye is particularly famous for good reason!
LongHorn Steakhouse: That distinctive Western-inspired architecture stands out against the North Dakota sky like a perfectly cooked ribeye on a white plate. Photo credit: Bruce K. What makes LongHorn special is their attention to quality control.
Even though it’s part of a larger chain, each location maintains high standards, and the Bismarck restaurant is no exception.
The menu offers great variety beyond just steaks – from fresh seafood to chicken and ribs – making it perfect for groups where not everyone wants beef.
But the steaks are definitely the star of the show.
The service team knows their stuff – they can tell you exactly how each cut differs and make recommendations based on your preferences.
It’s the kind of knowledge that enhances your dining experience.
Where: 1070 E Interstate Ave, Bismarck, ND 58503
8. The Naked Moose (Loraine) The Naked Moose: With a name this memorable and a patio this inviting, you know you’re in for a dining experience that’s anything but ordinary. Photo credit: Sue Ann Jaffarian With a name like “The Naked Moose,” you know you’re in for something different!
This unassuming spot in tiny Loraine proves that great steaks can be found in the most unexpected places.
The exterior might be simple – just a metal building with some fun signage – but don’t let that fool you.
Inside, it’s all about good food and good times.
Their steaks are the talk of the region – thick, juicy cuts cooked exactly how you like them.
The meat is always fresh and prepared with obvious skill and care.
The Naked Moose: Sometimes the most unassuming places hide the greatest treasures—this Loraine landmark proves that rule deliciously. Photo credit: Oliver S. What makes The Naked Moose special is its authentic North Dakota character.
There’s nothing pretentious here – just honest food served by friendly people in a place where everyone feels welcome.
The restaurant has that perfect small-town vibe where the line between regulars and newcomers quickly disappears.
You might come in as a tourist, but you’ll be treated like a neighbor.
The outdoor seating area with its fire pit is perfect for those beautiful North Dakota summer evenings.
It’s the kind of place where time slows down and conversations flow easily.
Where: 344-552 Main St, Loraine, ND 58761
9. Hacienda Steakhouse (Burlington) Hacienda Steakhouse: That bold red sign against the twilight sky is like a dinner bell calling you to a southwestern steak adventure in Burlington. Photo credit: Fannifa Hacienda Steakhouse catches your eye with its distinctive southwestern-inspired building and that bold red sign that stands out against the North Dakota sky.
It’s like a little piece of the southwest dropped into the northern plains!
Inside, the restaurant continues the southwestern theme with warm colors and unique architectural details like those round windows that give it character.
The atmosphere is casual but special.
Their steaks are prepared with a southwestern twist that sets them apart from other steakhouses in the region.
The flavors are bold without overwhelming the natural quality of the beef.
Hacienda Steakhouse: Snow-covered and still inviting, Hacienda’s distinctive architecture brings a touch of the southwest to North Dakota’s winter landscape. Photo credit: Kelsey Rusch What makes Hacienda special is how they blend steakhouse traditions with southwestern influences.
It’s not fusion for the sake of being different – it’s a thoughtful combination that creates something unique.
The menu offers great variety, with Mexican-inspired dishes alongside classic steakhouse fare.
It’s perfect for when you want a great steak but your dining companion is craving enchiladas!
Even in winter, when the snow piles up outside, the restaurant maintains that warm, inviting atmosphere that makes you forget about the cold.
It’s like a little vacation without leaving North Dakota.
Where: 135 Colton Ave, Burlington, ND 58722
10. Texas Roadhouse (Grand Forks) Texas Roadhouse: Those flags flying proudly announce what locals already know—this is where Grand Forks goes when serious steak cravings hit. Photo credit: Ron Ligsay Texas Roadhouse brings its distinctive log-cabin style building to Grand Forks, complete with those signature flags flying proudly out front.
It’s impossible to miss and instantly recognizable!
Inside, the restaurant has that energetic, slightly rowdy atmosphere that’s become their trademark.
The peanut shells on the floor, the line dancing servers – it’s all part of the experience.
Their steaks are hand-cut daily in the restaurant, which makes a noticeable difference in freshness and quality.
Each one comes out sizzling hot and seasoned to perfection.
What makes Texas Roadhouse special is their consistency.
Texas Roadhouse: Log cabin vibes and perfectly grilled steaks—this Grand Forks favorite proves that sometimes chain restaurants really do get it right. Photo credit: Calvin S. You know exactly what you’re getting – a great steak at a reasonable price in a fun atmosphere – and they deliver every time.
Those fresh-baked rolls with cinnamon butter that come before your meal are almost as famous as the steaks themselves.
They’re so good they’ve developed their own fan following!
The open kitchen concept lets you see the steaks being prepared, adding to the lively atmosphere and giving you confidence in the food preparation.
It’s dinner and a show all in one!
Where: 3200 32nd Ave S, Grand Forks, ND 58201
North Dakota’s steak scene proves you don’t need big city lights to find incredible beef.
From historic brick buildings to humble small-town spots, these ten restaurants serve up steaks worth crossing county lines for!
